sentences: Paljud inimesed ootavad uut aastat pidu.
context: The word 'aasta' is the Estonian noun for 'year'. It can appear in different forms depending on grammatical case and number. In nominative singular it means 'a year', while in genitive singular ('aasta') it typically indicates possession or time reference. The word comes from Proto-Finnic origins and is used to refer to a period of 365/366 days.
